body.p: The content of an indexterm element is used to produce an index entry in the generated index. You can nest indexterm elements to create multi-level indexes. The content is not output as part of the topic content, only as part of the index tree.
To add index to your publication, you just need to add index terms to the topics metadata:

body.p: In case you are using a bookmap, you need to specify where the index list should be presented, for instance in the backmatter of the book. (Technically it is possible to add it also to the frontmatter, but this is unusual). This is done using an indexlist element in the booklists in the backmatter:
For plain maps, the index list is automatically added at the end of the publication, with no need to modify the map.
